alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 5:30PM PDT until August 24 at 10:15PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN IMPERIAL COUNTY... At 530 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Salton City, Ocotillo, Salton Sea Beach, Desert Shores, Mountain Spring, Winona, Coyote Wells and Coolidge Springs. This includes the following highways... CA Route 78 between mile markers 10 and 13...and between mile markers 6 and 9. CA Route 98 between mile markers 1 and 3. CA Interstate 8 near mile marker 1...and between mile markers 10 and 15...and between mile markers 3 and 5. CA Route 86 between mile markers 35 and 44. This includes the following streams and drainages... Salton Sea, Carrizo Wash, South Fork Palm Wash, Tule Wash, Wonderstone Wash, Salt Creek Slough, Myer Creek, Coral Wash, Fish Creek Wash, Tarantula Wash, San Felipe Creek, Palm Canyon Wash, Boulder Creek and Gert Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
